definition: (idiom) sunlight shines over all things/drenched in sunlight

sentences.english: The open of prison affairs is called the sunlight project in our country's prison system.
sentences.chinese: 狱务公开被誉为我国监狱系统的阳光工程。

sentences.english: Other plants can't do without tanking up loads of sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 其它的植物就非得饱尝充足的阳光。

sentences.english: The sun blistered the paint on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 在阳光下墙上的油漆起气泡了。

sentences.english: No problem is permanent storms always give way to the sun.
sentences.chinese: 风暴总会给阳光让路，寒冬总会转变为暖春。

sentences.english: Living things depend on the sunlight.
These plants must be sheltered from direct sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物必须遮起来，免受阳光直射。

sentences.english: The gold glinted in the sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 金子在阳光下闪闪发光。

sentences.english: One is a spectrometer that measures sunlight reflected from the Earth's surface.
sentences.chinese: 一个是光谱仪，它测量从地球表面反射的阳光。

sentences.english: Have a bright shape, lively & open, auto fans, a member of amateur racing car organization.
sentences.chinese: 形象阳光，活泼开朗，喜爱汽车，参加业余赛车队。

sentences.english: In the morning sunshine, underwater world was beautiful vi-sion.
sentences.chinese: 在早晨阳光的照射下，海底世界美得如梦如幻。

sentences.english: Sunshine Town is a great place to live and you will love it here.
sentences.chinese: 阳光城是一个居住的好地方，你在这里一定会喜欢它。

sentences.english: That reflected in the thick snow on the sun, my happiness reflects the chest.
sentences.chinese: 那映在厚厚雪地上的阳光，将我的快乐折射出胸膛。

sentences.english: Black carbon absorbs solar radiation, warming the atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 炭黑吸收阳光辐射，让大气增温。

sentences.english: Shafts of sunlight through the trees.
The windows glinted in the sun.
Life consists of not only sunshine but also hard times.
sentences.chinese: 生活不仅充满阳光也会有困难时期。

definition: (idiom) sunlight shines over all things/drenched in sunlight
